metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3119 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The process_db_args function in plugins/kdb/ldap/libkdb_ldap/ldap_principal2.c in the LDAP KDB module in kadmind in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.13.4 and 1.14.x through 1.14.1 mishandles the DB argument, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via a crafted request to modify a principal. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain requests. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-gss-samples - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-kdc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-locales - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-multidev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-otp - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-pkinit - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
krb5-user - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libgssrpc4 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libk5crypto3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkadm5srv-mit8 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkdb5-7 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkrad0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkrb5-3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
libkrb5support0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> kadmind is not supported in core and touch

criterions.comment: krb5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4').
